message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.DM, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the problem of guarding a polyhedron, which is a classic problem in computational geometry and falls under the category of computational geometry (cs.CG). The use of reflex edges and the focus on the number of guards needed suggests that the paper may also fall under the categories of discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and graph theory (cs.GT). The algorithmic aspect of the paper, including the computation of guard locations, suggests that it may also fall under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) and possibly even social and information networks (cs.SI) due to the potential applications of the problem in network security.
